em.rationale: Most actionable, causal, decomposable delivery metric. Fix the long pole and everything else improves.
The arbitration tool. Budget remaining → ship. Budget burned → freeze. Turns politics into math.
Often 40-60% of Lead Time. The #1 AI-era bottleneck — AI-generated PRs inflate review load. Biggest lever for LT improvement.
Quality counterweight to velocity. Without it, you might be shipping garbage fast.
Only cheap, reliable leading indicator of attrition and velocity decline. 5 questions, 10 minutes.
Best proxy for predictability. 85%+ earns trust and autonomy.
Fastest path to burnout. Outsized impact on affected engineers.
Monthly reliability view. How often did we meet our targets?
Incident response effectiveness. Reactive but important.
3-item Maslach survey. Leading indicator of everything going wrong.
When LT/sprint accuracy are bad, locate dependency issues.
The gap between perceived and measured AI benefit is the diagnostic. Too granular for top-8.
When CFR is bad, check how often we undo releases.
Tertiary — outcome orientation but the value is in the process, not the score.

director.rationale: Most expensive metric to get wrong. $200K-$500K+ per departure. Pattern analysis predicts the next one.
The org-level reliability scorecard. Which services are chronically unreliable? Where to invest?
Leading indicator for #1-ranked Attrition. Spot teams in trouble 6-12 months before departures confirm it.
Where capacity goes. 15-20% protected for debt/platform is non-negotiable.
Strategic AI bet. The gap between perceived and measured AI benefit predicts whether investment will help or hurt.
How you justify the org's existence and defend headcount.
Are teams following the freeze/slowdown policy? If not, SLO compliance will degrade.
Find structural bottlenecks. Compare with archetype context.
Predicts whether AI investment will help or hurt.
Efficiency at scale. The CFO metric.
Context for SLO compliance. Hot services.
Team-level diagnostic for dependency issues. Not director-level strategic.
Tertiary — cross-team alignment signal. Are OKRs driving behavior or sitting in a doc?
